Paper.Title: Sydney, July 2006. c(c)2006 Association for Computational Linguistics POC-NLW Template for Chinese Word Segmentation

Section.Paragraph: In this paper, a language tagging template named POC-NLW (position of a character within an n-length word) is presented. Based on this template, a two-stage statistical model for Chinese word segmentation is constructed. In this method, the basic word segmentation is based on n-gram language model, and a Hidden Markov tagger based on the POC-NLW template is used to implement the out-of-vocabulary (OOV) word identification. The system participated in the MSRA_Close and UPUC_Close word segmentation tracks at SIGHAN Bakeoff 2006. Results returned by this bakeoff are reported here.
